content.raw:
Oh, I’m sorry, the gist got a bit messy.

Clean build: [cmake](https://gist.githubusercontent.com/peci1/9f135632259fe822efe90922bba0c508/raw/422071ce55f1396d9af8049fe9331691ba47fe1b/cmake%2520output%2520clean), [build](https://gist.githubusercontent.com/peci1/9f135632259fe822efe90922bba0c508/raw/393a5357fd2fef8796b6713bd7d8554e4745351b/clean%2520build%2520output) \(truncated for some reason\)

Rebuild: [cmake](https://gist.githubusercontent.com/peci1/9f135632259fe822efe90922bba0c508/raw/422071ce55f1396d9af8049fe9331691ba47fe1b/cmake%2520output%2520rebuild%2520after%2520touching%2520CMakeCache.txt) \(truncated by me\), [build](https://gist.githubusercontent.com/peci1/9f135632259fe822efe90922bba0c508/raw/393a5357fd2fef8796b6713bd7d8554e4745351b/rebuild%2520output) 

The build uses catkin, which is a ROS build system, but that shouldn’t be the problem, because it worked before and is officially supported by Gazebo. In the end, it nevertheless only calls cmake and make. The check phase is IMO the same as cmake phase.
content.html:
Oh, I’m sorry, the gist got a bit messy.

Clean build: cmake, build (truncated for some reason)

Rebuild: cmake (truncated by me), build

The build uses catkin, which is a ROS build system, but that shouldn’t be the problem, because it worked before and is officially supported by Gazebo. In the end, it nevertheless only calls cmake and make. The check phase is IMO the same as cmake phase.
